data.title: Fayetteville, AR - Official Website
data.meta_description: All drivers must have a valid unexpired license from one of the United States or a valid, unexpired International license. The State of Arkansas requires that you obtain an Arkansas driver's license if you will be in the state for more than six months.
data.text:
All drivers must have a valid unexpired license from one of the United States or a valid, unexpired International license. You may drive legally with a license from your home country if you also have an international license (both are required).

The State of Arkansas requires that you obtain an Arkansas driver’s license if you will be in the state for more than six months.

The University of Arkansas offers a guide to obtaining an Arkansas driver’s license. It is intended for U of A students but has helpful information for anyone.

To get an Arkansas driver’s license you must pass both a written test (taken on a computer), and an actual driving test.

Where to go to take your driver’s license written and driving tests

Arkansas State Police Driver Testing Services

Address: 1120 W Monroe Ave., Lowell, AR 72745

Phone: 479-751-3619

Hours: 8 - 11 a.m. and 1 - 4 p.m.

No driving tests will be issued if it is raining or the roads are wet.

Where to go to get your license after you have passed your tests

Arkansas Revenue Office

Address: 3086 M.L.K. Jr Blvd, Fayetteville, AR 72704

Phone: 479-442-7691

Hours: Monday through Friday 8 a.m. - 4:30 p.m.

Language Help

The knowledge portion of the test (commonly known as the computer or written test) is given in four languages: English, Spanish, Vietnamese and Marshallese. A dictionary is allowed for other languages, but it has to be a book with no notes written inside it.

Interpreters are not allowed to ride along during the driving part of the test.
